snippet: The Taliban said they had no part in the assault this week on the offices of the International Committee of the Red Cross in Jalalabad, Afghanistan, noting their previous support for the group.
abstract: Taliban denies any role in suicide assault against International Committee of the Red Cross, days after being roundly condemned for targeting humanitarian agency, emphasizing that they respect group's neutrality; attack came as a shock to the agency, which has worked in Afghanistan for roughly 30 years and has not suffered a direct attack by the Taliban.

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and MATTHEW ROSENBERG
byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed reported from Kabul, and Matthew Rosenberg from Washington. Habib Zahori contributed reporting from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: The Taliban said they had no part in the assault this week on the offices of the International Committee of the Red Cross in Jalalabad, Afghanistan, noting their previous support for the group.

headline.main: Taliban Deny Responsibility for Attack on Red Cross
headline.print_headline: Taliban Deny Responsibility for Suicide Attack on Red Cross in Afghanistan

keywords.value: International Committee of the Red Cross
keywords.name: organizations
